message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.RO 

This paper deals with natural language processing and machine learning techniques for improving writing skills. Specifically, it focuses on proper word choice, which falls under the category of lexical semantics. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper also uses bidirectional LSTM, which is a popular deep learning technique, making cs.LG (Machine Learning) another likely sub-category. Additionally, the paper involves unsupervised learning, which falls under cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The paper also mentions using a high-quality text corpus, which suggests a possible connection to cs.IR (Information Retrieval). Finally, the paper mentions sharing code and pre-trained models, which could be relevant to cs.RO (Robotics and Automation) if the models are intended for use in writing support systems.
